name: Headley Heath Bluebell Walk, Box Hill

ai.summary: Headley Heath Bluebell Walk is an 8.5 km moderate hike near Box Hill in Surrey, England. The route weaves through ancient woodlands and open heath, with grassy trails and gentle climbs, and is especially popular in spring when bluebells carpet the forest floor.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of well-marked dirt and grassy paths, with occasional rocky or uneven sections. Elevation changes are gentle to moderate, and some sections can be muddy after rain. Good footwear with grip is advised.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and dress for changing conditions. Stay on marked trails and be mindful of other walkers and cyclists on shared paths. Wear sturdy boots with good grip; bring water and snacks; carry a map or offline navigation. In peak bloom, preserve the habitat by staying on trails and keeping dogs under control.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing with a waterproof outer layer
Map or offline navigation (GPS) or a charged phone
Small first-aid kit and basic emergency supplies
ai.best_seasons: Spring (late March–May) for bluebell displays; early autumn is mild and quieter; summer offers longer days but fewer bluebells.

seo.title: Headley Heath Bluebell Walk – 8.5 km Moderate Hike near Box Hill, Surrey | UK
seo.meta_description: Discover an 8.5 km moderate hike through Headley Heath and Box Hill's bluebell woods in Surrey, England. Trail overview, terrain, safety tips, and gear recommendations.
